title: Fonts in these beautiful US Dollar Redesigns
content:
These redesigns belong to the [Dollar Rede$ign Project](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218/http:/richardsmith.posterous.com/).

First one by [Michael Tyznik](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218/http:/richardsmith.posterous.com/dollar-redeign-michael-tyznik). I'd like to know the font for numerals: '20', '50' (Trade Gothic?) and the font used for 'Twenty dollars', 'Fifty dollars'. I know they're easy, but I can't figure them out.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218im_/http:/typophile.com/files/20_obverse_final_3622.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218im_/http:/typophile.com/files/50_obverse_final_4684.jpg)

Second one by [Michelle Haft](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218/http:/richardsmith.posterous.com/dollar-redeign-michelle-haft). That nice font for numerals.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218im_/http:/typophile.com/files/currency2_michellehaft_3516.jpg)

Thanks!
author: dedaluz

comments.content:

the slab in #1 is [Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218/http:/vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/) by [Christian Schwartz](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413235218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Christian%20Schwartz).

Those are my redesigns at top :)

He's right, the slab is Stag.  
The sans-serif numerals are in Akzidenz Grotesk Bold Condensed.
